input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: IGRETEC. Summary: Supply Contract for the Rental of a Grc Solution for the Governance of Information System Security Risks and Iso/Iec27001 and Nis2 Compliance.. Description: Contract for the rental of a GRC solution for the Governance of Information System Security Risks and ISO/IEC27001 and NIS2 Compliance. IGRETEC wishes to acquire a GRC solution allowing: • the analysis and treatment of risks according to the methodology used by the Government Adjudicator as described in the technical clauses of the specifications • management of compliance with ISO/IEC 27001 and 27002 standards; • the integration of the CyFun Essentiel repository (Cybersecurity Fundamentals provided by the Belgian Cybersecurity Center) within the framework of the NIS2 directive ; • the centralization of data related to risks, incidents, suppliers, policies and action plans; • a multi-user collaborative mode with SaaS security guarantees and compliance with the GDPR.<br> Category (CPV code): Software package and information systems (48000000). input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: HOEGAARDEN. Summary: Civil Affairs Software. Description: Object of these services: Civil affairs software. Explanation: The Hoegaarden municipal council is reviewing the current software landscape surrounding its civil affairs and reception department (population, civil registry and immigration affairs). Currently the service worked in different applications from different suppliers. This has a number of limitations: • files are becoming more complex and family members are increasingly registered in different registers and have different questions at the same time (such as an application for permanent residence in Belgium, simultaneously with an application for Belgian nationality); • employees who take on different roles within the cell must regularly switch to a different working environment; • the learning curve for new employees is unnecessarily high because they have to get to know multiple applications; • a more flexible work organization within the service is more difficult to achieve; • cost-effectiveness, including in terms of connections to be made. Therefore wishes the board to receive one total quotation for the following modules: • Population, including digital housing control; • Foreigners; • Civil status. Place of provision of services: Civil Affairs and Reception, Gemeenteplein 1, 3320 Hoegaarden The contracting party The government ensures that this assignment is carried out in compliance with anti-discrimination legislation. Category (CPV code): Software supply services (72268000). Published Date: 2025-11-06. Closing Date: 2026-01-16. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Civil Affairs Software
output.Description: Object of these services: Civil affairs software. Explanation: The Hoegaarden municipal council is reviewing the current software landscape surrounding its civil affairs and reception department (population, civil registry and immigration affairs). Currently the service worked in different applications from different suppliers. Therefore wishes the board to receive one total quotation for the following modules: • Population, including digital housing control; • Foreigners; • Civil status. Summary: Award of a Public Service Contract as Part of a Framework Contract for Consulting and Programming of our Cafm System Ifs Ultimo. Description: The Service and Logistics Service of the German-speaking Community uses the IFS Ultimo software solution as a CAFM system to support its infrastructural and technical facility management. The introduction will take place gradually. The aim is to use Ultimo as a central tool for: • Maintenance, • fault reports, • resource planning, • controlling • as well as the entire property and maintenance management to be established permanently. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: FLEMISH ENVIRONMENT AGENCY. Summary: Preparation of Regional Groundwater Models of the Phreatic Aquifer for the Groundwater Simulator. Description: The object of the assignment concerns the preparation of regional groundwater models of the phreatic aquifer for the groundwater simulator. With the groundwater simulator (see https://www.dov.vlaanderen.be/page/grondwatersimulator) the effect of local interventions in the phreatic groundwater can be calculated everywhere in Flanders. For this purpose, the groundwater simulator uses five regional Modflow6 groundwater flow models in the background. The aim of this assignment is to improve the regional to improve groundwater flow models (Modflow6) used in the groundwater simulator. There are currently 5 regional models in the background of the groundwater simulator. The remodeling of the regional models aims to: to refine grid sizes and obtain a finer layer layout. Some of the existing models will therefore be split into smaller areas. Furthermore, a thorough calibration must be carried out with attention to a passing grade differentiation within the Quaternary Aquifer. Any new available data sets must be processed. The present assignment concerns 6 model areas that have been bundled into 3 plots. Each lot contains two models Category (CPV code): Analytical, scientific, mathematical or forecasting software development services (72212460). Published Date: 2025-10-26. Closing Date: 2025-11-20. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: ZIEKENHUIS AAN DE STROOM VZW (ZAS). Summary: Innovative Partnership for the further Development and Deployment of an Ai-Based Clinical Documentation Improvement Tool. Description: In 2025, ZAS had a prototype based on an AI algorithm developed, a Clinical Documentation Improvement tool (CDI), which is able to distill diagnoses from EPD-generated letters, analyze them for relevance within the context and convert them to Snomed codes, then compare it with the patient's existing EPD problem list and, if there is none, ask the doctor involved whether these diagnoses can be added to the problem list and then automatically add them to the EPD problem list if the answer is positive. The prototype was developed and trained for 6 medical disciplines of ZAS and integrated into Hix, the EPD of ZAS, via FHIR interfaces. Doctors from these disciplines have used and validated the prototype. The prototype is very promising and ZAS now wants to develop a production-worthy version based on an innovative partnership the experiences with the prototype, rolling it out to all medical disciplines (30) within ZAS (and possibly other hospitals) as well as further development according to ZAS's vision regarding structured problem list in the EPD. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: THE FLEMISH RADIO AND TELEVISION BROADCASTER. Summary: Product Experience Manager Tool/Cms. Description: VRT wishes to build a future-oriented and expandable Product Experience Manager tool and to purchase a headless CMS with sufficient options that will serve as the core of our Product Experience Manager tool. The development of this tool should enable us to control and manage the manage the appearance of all our digital products (apps and sites) in one central place. This includes visually configuring swim lanes, banners, navigation, and the layout of main and landing pages. The headless CMS must be API-first and compatible with modern front-end technologies, with support for content workflows, role management and integrations with existing systems such as DAMs. We also expect the tool to include a mechanism to transmit events and changes to external systems in (near) real-time. In addition, we attach great importance to user-friendliness, scalability, security and GDPR compliance.<br> 2025/OO/809 - 1<br> See selection guidelines<br> Doc Title: Product Experience Manager tool/CMS<br> Contract Type: supplies. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG GROW - INTERNAL MARKET, INDUSTRY, ENTREPRENEURSHIP AND SMES. Summary: Technical/It Support on the Formulation of an it Tool for Calculating the Energy Label of Smartphones and Tablets. Description: The Energy Labelling Regulation 2023/1669 requires that smartphones and tablets display information on their energy efficiency, battery longevity, protection from dust and water and resistance to accidental drops. The value of the Energy Efficiency Index (EEI) is used for the identification of the energy labelling class to which the product belongs to. In order to support manufacturers and market surveillance authorities, the Commission intends to develop through an outsourcing procedure a tool/application for the calculation of the EEI, in line with the requirements laid down under Regulation 2023/1669. <br> Doc Title: Technical/IT support on the formulation of an IT tool for calculating the energy label of smartphones and tablets <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 200000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-10-21. Closing Date: 2025-12-05. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG GROW - INTERNAL MARKET, INDUSTRY, ENTREPRENEURSHIP AND SMES
output.Summary: Technical/It Support on the Formulation of an it Tool for Calculating the Energy Label of Smartphones and Tablets
output.Description: The Energy Labelling Regulation 2023/1669 requires that smartphones and tablets display information on their energy efficiency, battery longevity, protection from dust and water and resistance to accidental drops. The value of the Energy Efficiency Index (EEI) is used for the identification of the energy labelling class to which the product belongs to. In order to support manufacturers and market surveillance authorities, the Commission intends to develop through an outsourcing procedure a tool/application for the calculation of the EEI, in line with the requirements laid down under Regulation 2023/1669. <br> Doc Title: Technical/IT support on the formulation of an IT tool for calculating the energy label of smartphones and tablets <br> Contract Type: services

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG GROW - INTERNAL MARKET, INDUSTRY, ENTREPRENEURSHIP AND SMES. Summary: Business Intelligence Services. Description: The European Commission's Directorate General for Internal Market, Industry, Entrepreneurship and SMEs (DG GROW) has set up a new team to centralise the collection, analysis, and dissemination of business intelligence. The focus is hereby on company-level information and insights with a bearing on Europe-s economic security or competitiveness (e.g. interrupted supply-chains, planned relocations, …). DG GROW is seeking a contractor to help gathering Business Intelligence, inter alia by providing a pool of industry experts that can be consulted on request, running quick surveys of enterprises in specific fields and undertaking desk-research. <br> Doc Title: Business Intelligence Services <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 1550000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-10-09. Closing Date: 2025-12-09. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: BRUSSELS CONNECTIT. Summary: Analysis and Advice Financial Planning and Forecasting. Description: Within the SPRB, the current multi -year budget and staff planning process is fragmented and non -standardized. Each administration uses its own working tools and methods. The data is exported to Excel files, adapted to the expected structure and loaded in different tools, which creates confusion as to the source of forecasts and simulations. This mission aims to examine how to develop a uniform working method and what tools would be appropriate for this purpose. The study focuses on three cases of representatives involving four administrations: Brussels Synergie, Finance and Budget, Local Powers and Connect IT. The results of this study will lead to a recommendation concerning L-Organization to be implemented, the knowledge necessary to acquire as well as the support tools, which will be implemented in a later phase. The mission will also have to provide information on d-investment and operating budgets to be expected. Category (CPV Code): IT Services: Consulting, Software Development, Internet and Support (72000000). Published Date: 2025-10-05. Closing Date: 2025-10-31. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Analysis and Advice Financial Planning and Forecasting
output.Description: Within the SPRB, the current multi -year budget and staff planning process is fragmented and non -standardized. Each administration uses its own working tools and methods. The data is exported to Excel files, adapted to the expected structure and loaded in different tools, which creates confusion as to the source of forecasts and simulations. This mission aims to examine how to develop a uniform working method and what tools would be appropriate for this purpose. It will perform specialized support to the EIC Awardees (including blended finance startups selected under the EIC pilot and beneficiaries of the STEP action) in fundraising for technology development, market deployment and scale-up. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG DIGIT - DIGITAL SERVICES. Summary: High-Level Advice and Consultancy Services (Hacs). As described above, the main scope of the new HACS procedure is the replacement of BEACON lot 2, considering that, under the original BEACON framework contracts, the majority of the services were ordered under lot 2. While BEACON lot 1 is not scheduled for replacement as a separate lot or procedure, the technical scope of services previously ordered under BEACON lot 1 will also be covered by the new procedure. Consequently, the new HACS procedure is not split into lots. <br> Doc Title: High-level advice and consultancy services (HACS) <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 243317267. Currency: EUR. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG GROW - INTERNAL MARKET, INDUSTRY, ENTREPRENEURSHIP AND SMES. Summary: Development and Adaptation of Life Cycle Information for Construction Products to be Used in the Context of Regulation (Eu) 2024/3110. Description: This call for tenders includes the development of Construction Products Regulation (CPR - Regulation (EU) 2024/3110) compliant datasets related to construction products. In case datasets are not available in the environmental footprint compliant databases they will be developed for its use both under the CPR and as environmental footprint compliant datasets. In case they are already available in the environmental compliant databases, they will be developed for its use under the CPR taking the environmental footprint compliant databases as input. The tenders shall provide information about the scope of pre-existing information/data, their source and when and how the rights to these information/data have been or will be acquired. This information is required to ensure homogeneous implementation of the environmental assessment of construction products under the CPR, to facilitate the mandatory calculation for SMEs and to ensure consistency in the assessment of products assessed using the environmental footprint and the CPR. <br> Doc Title: Development and adaptation of life cycle information for construction products to be used in the context of Regulation (EU) 2024/3110 <br> Contract Type: services. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG DIGIT - DIGITAL SERVICES. Summary: High-Level Advice and Consultancy Services (Hacs). Description: Multiple FWCs for the provision of advisory/consultancy services (high-level consultancy and studies), ensuring business continuity after the expiration of the framework contracts under Lot 2 of ‘BEACON - Benchmarking, Advisory and Consultancy Services in Information and Communication Technology' resulting from the DIGIT/2020/OP/0005 - Benchmarking, Advisory and Consultancy Services in Information and Communication Technology - Lot 1 and Lot 2 Call for Tenders published in 2021. As described above, the main scope of the new HACS procedure is the replacement of BEACON lot 2, considering that, under the original BEACON framework contracts, the majority of the services were ordered under lot 2. While BEACON lot 1 is not scheduled for replacement as a separate lot or procedure, the technical scope of services previously ordered under BEACON lot 1 will also be covered by the new procedure. Consequently, the new HACS procedure is not split into lots. <br> Doc Title: High-level advice and consultancy services (HACS) <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 243317267. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-09-16. Closing Date: 2025-09-29. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Summary: High-Level Advice and Consultancy Services (Hacs)

As described above, the main scope of the new HACS procedure is the replacement of BEACON lot 2, considering that, under the original BEACON framework contracts, the majority of the services were ordered under lot 2. While BEACON lot 1 is not scheduled for replacement as a separate lot or procedure, the technical scope of services previously ordered under BEACON lot 1 will also be covered by the new procedure. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: BRUSSELS AIRPORT COMPANY NV. Summary: Services for the Helpdesk Infrastructure & Facilities (Hif). Description: Framework agreement for supplying crew for a technical help desk and related services. The Helpdesk Infrastructure and Facilities (HIF) of Brussels Airport Company (BAC) manages the analysis, handling and follow -up of technical alarms and service applications with regard to Airport activa, facilities and systems that fall under the competence of BAC. The HIF also supports BAC Parking Management and BAC Customer Care during the night and weekend hours. Every year the HIF processes around 30,000 tickets based on alarms, calls, e-mails and direct Reports from employees (Front Office). The technical interventions often require immediate action and are performed by multidisciplinary employees (Field Office). These interventions are performed by the HIF and relate to a wide range of operational issues. The Hif Also takes care of the operational management of the issue of (fire) permits (Back Office). On average, around 1,400 (fire) permits are processed annually. All processes must be carried out in a customer -oriented way, with the necessary coordination with all parties involved as well as with an efficient Implementation of it. This assignment concerns a framework agreement for a duration of 3 years, twice extended for a period of 1 year each.<br> BAC/2025/056 - 1<br> Framework agreement for supplying crew for a technical help desk and related services. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN INNOVATION COUNCIL AND SMES EXECUTIVE AGENCY (EISMEA), EISMEA - EUROPEAN INNOVATION COUNCIL AND SMES EXECUTIVE AGENCY. Summary: Stakeholders Support Platform. Description: The subject of this call for tenders “Stakeholders Support Platform” is to renew and enhance the existing Transition Pathways Stakeholder Support Platform (transition-pathways.europa.eu). The objective is to further develop, maintain and improve the existing Transition Pathways Stakeholder Support Platform to an even more integrated and collaborative tool for industrial ecosystems to support public and private stakeholders in their green and digital transitions, resilience, and competitiveness. Under the renewed - and renamed - ‘Stakeholders Support Platform-, this will be a one stop shop, which provides a user-friendly entry point for stakeholders: - to access actively updated information and links to official and community resources relevant for each ecosystem; - to find constantly updated knowledge on ongoing projects, EU policy implementation, activities, business and best practices and events for each ecosystem; - to provide a means to connect with, engage and work together with the members of the stakeholder community and - to search or to be alerted about topical current funding and learning opportunities or other developments . <br> Doc Title: Stakeholders Support Platform <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 4000000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-09-01. Closing Date: 2025-10-20. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Other Funding Agencies

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN INNOVATION COUNCIL AND SMES EXECUTIVE AGENCY (EISMEA), EISMEA - EUROPEAN INNOVATION COUNCIL AND SMES EXECUTIVE AGENCY

Description: The ZAS hospitals are looking for a software solution for the management of allergens and recipes in their different kitchens. instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: SIBELGA. Summary: Control System Adms (Future Requirements). Description: In dit document beschrijft Sibelga de toekomstige behoeften voor de ontwikkeling van haar bedrijfsvoeringssysteem (ADMS). Elke behoefte wordt beschreven in termen van onze huidige visie op de evolutie van het net van Sibelga naar een intelligenter en actiever beheer (Smart-Grid). Deze beschrijving is voor aanpassing vatbaar. Deze behoeften kunnen als volgt worden samengevat: Sibelga wil tools implementeren om het gevaar voor congestie van haar netwerk in realtime ofzelfs enkele dagen vooraf te kunnen detecteren. Zodra de risico's geïdentificeerd zijn, moet de meest geschikte actie worden ondernomen om ze beperkt te houden. Twee soorten acties worden overwogen: rechtstreekse acties (sturen van instructies of een Operational envelope) betreffende de gebruikers van de risicozone, of onrechtstreekse acties door de zones te melden aan de marktspelers, zodat zij de gepaste acties kunnen ondernemen. Twee extra behoeften worden toegevoegd. Het gaat om de constructie van een digital twin en een netsimulator voor oefeningen en opleidingen. Deze functies zijn gelinkt aan de vorige, in die zin dat ze op hetzelfde netmodel en dezelfde berekeningswijze steunen. Van de respondenten wordt verwacht dat ze voor elke behoefte beschrijven waarover ze reeds beschikken en welke grote of kleine verschillen er zijn ten opzichte van deze beschrijving. Om aan het RFI te voldoen, hoeft niet op alle behoeften gereageerd te worden. Een uitvoerige lijst van vragen bevindt zich op het einde van het documen.... Published Date: 2025-08-21. Closing Date: 2025-10-05. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Control System Adms (Future Requirements)
output.Description: In dit document beschrijft Sibelga de toekomstige behoeften voor de ontwikkeling van haar bedrijfsvoeringssysteem (ADMS). Elke behoefte wordt beschreven in termen van onze huidige visie op de evolutie van het net van Sibelga naar een intelligenter en actiever beheer (Smart-Grid). Deze beschrijving is voor aanpassing vatbaar. Deze behoeften kunnen als volgt worden samengevat: Sibelga wil tools implementeren om het gevaar voor congestie van haar netwerk in realtime ofzelfs enkele dagen vooraf te kunnen detecteren. Zodra de risico's geïdentificeerd zijn, moet de meest geschikte actie worden ondernomen om ze beperkt te houden. Twee soorten acties worden overwogen: rechtstreekse acties (sturen van instructies of een Operational envelope) betreffende de gebruikers van de risicozone, of onrechtstreekse acties door de zones te melden aan de marktspelers, zodat zij de gepaste acties kunnen ondernemen. Twee extra behoeften worden toegevoegd. Het gaat om de constructie van een digital twin en een netsimulator voor oefeningen en opleidingen. Deze functies zijn gelinkt aan de vorige, in die zin dat ze op hetzelfde netmodel en dezelfde berekeningswijze steunen. Van de respondenten wordt verwacht dat ze voor elke behoefte beschrijven waarover ze reeds beschikken en welke grote of kleine verschillen er zijn ten opzichte van deze beschrijving. Om aan het RFI te voldoen, hoeft niet op alle behoeften gereageerd te worden. Een uitvoerige lijst van vragen bevindt zich op het einde van het documen...

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: BRUSSELS INSTITUTE FOR ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT. Summary: Improvement of the Accounting of Heat Pumps in the Energy Balance of the Brussels-capital Region. Description: Energy consumption and productions on the regional territory are quantified each year in order to establish the energy balance (Ben) of the Brussels-Capital Region (RBC). This information allows the Region, on the one hand, to meet the legal obligations of annual reporting on air-climat-energy (ACE) emanating from Belgian, European and international bodies, and on the other hand, to have encrypted information to contribute to the establishment and the evaluation of regional policies as well as to decision-making. These data also contribute to the development of inventories and projections of greenhouse gas (GHG) and air pollutants. Each year, targeted studies and/or surveys are carried out in support of the production of the regional energy balance. Their objective is to collect data and information with a view to improving the quality and precision of the results of the balance sheet and thus having a better knowledge of the energy situation in RBC. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: BELGOPROCESS NV. Summary: Drawing Management System. Description: Belgoprocess is looking for a new drawing management system for central management, consultation and visualization of technical drawings. This system must contribute to an efficient and structured approach to drawing management, both internally and in collaboration with external partners. Belgoprocess Uses different drawing packages as standard, including AutoCAD, Inventor, Revit and others. Maximum integration with these packages is therefore essential. Further details about the software used can be found in the appendix of this RFI. The desired system must at least provided for in the following general functionalities: • Status management of documents and drawings • Rolling management and access control • Automatic notifications • A flexible and configurable approval flow, it is also important that external parties (such as contractors, study agencies or Partners) can gain access to the system in a safe and controlled manner. The drawing management system must support modern authentication standards and make APIs available so that drawings can easily be integrated into existing applications of Belgoprocess. To Slot is expected to support the system at least two separate environments: an acceptance environment and a production environment in order to make a controlled roll -out and management possible.<br> Category (CPV code): Document Management Software Package (48311000). Published Date: 2025-08-18. Closing Date: 2025-09-12. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Summary: Sustaining the Mission Implementation Platform for the Adaptation to Climate Change Mission. Description: Under this public procurement, the following services are expected to be provided: •Well-coordinated support to the general operation and activities of the Adaptation to Climate Change Mission, as valid service to the European Commission in the broad range of activities involved with the implementation of the Mission; •Coordination and facilitation of the Mission Community of Practice, in all its articulations (such as virtual and physical events, thematic working groups etc.), proving engaging involvement and opportunities for exchanges for all involved actors and regions, in relation to the actions they are undertaking in the field of climate resilience building; •Provide support to regions and local authorities on financing their climate resilience and adaptation projects; •Continuous and ad hoc monitoring and assistance to the European Commission in relation to any Mission evaluation, by maintaining and improving the current monitoring framework, further refining monitoring tools and KPI for the Mission, producing timely reporting on progress. •Assistance to the Commission with the overall communication on the Mission, through the different relevant channels including the Mission Portal, broadly towards citizens and also specific target audiences, helping to identify and create synergies and add value to communication, dissemination and exploitation activities of individual projects of the Mission's portfolio, and boost scientific, societal and economic impacts. •Or.... input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: AGENCY FOR GOVERNMENT EMPLOYEES. Summary: Configuration and Integration of Job Distribution Platform and Purchase of Posting Credits. Description: This assignment includes the configuration and integration of a job distribution platform and the associated purchase of technical posting credits. Specifically, this is about the purchase of licenses for a software package that makes it possible to post vacancies directly from CSOD to multiple job boards. In addition, we want to be able to purchase technical posting credits to be able to place a vacancy to one or more job boards via the job distribution platform. The integration of the new software package with CSOD is a technical minimum requirement. The software package that the object makes of this assignment must have a validated connection with CSOD. Category (CPV code): Software-Related Services (72260000). Published Date: 2025-08-14. Closing Date: 2025-09-12. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Configuration and Integration of Job Distribution Platform and Purchase of Posting Credits

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: BRUSSELS AIRPORT COMPANY NV. Summary: Enabling Data-Driven Airport Vision with Integrated Simulation and Monitoring for End-To-End Operational Excellence (Endavismon). Description: Our eAOP project has been defined to realize these capabilities. Its main objectives are to: • Establish real-time visibility of operational performance; • Detect saturation points or anomalies across the passenger, baggage and air journeys; • Understand the interdependencies among operational processes; • Strengthen BAC's resilience by enabling faster responses to disruptions; we seek solutions that serve multiple business domains and deliver the required functionalities across passenger, baggage, cargo and air operations. We categorized the elements in scope as either: • Business Capabilities • Enablers • Visualisation solutions Through this RFI, we aim to explore the market for potential partners who can help realise these solutions and help develop maturity in the business capabilities and enablers described below.<br> Category (CPV code): Data management services (72322000). input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG DIGIT - DIGITAL SERVICES. Summary: High-Level Advice and Consultancy Services (Hacs). Description: Multiple FWCs for the provision of advisory/consultancy services (high-level consultancy and studies), ensuring business continuity after the expiration of the framework contracts under Lot 2 of ‘BEACON - Benchmarking, Advisory and Consultancy Services in Information and Communication Technology' resulting from the DIGIT/2020/OP/0005 - Benchmarking, Advisory and Consultancy Services in Information and Communication Technology - Lot 1 and Lot 2 Call for Tenders published in 2021. As described above, the main scope of the new HACS procedure is the replacement of BEACON lot 2, considering that, under the original BEACON framework contracts, the majority of the services were ordered under lot 2. While BEACON lot 1 is not scheduled for replacement as a separate lot or procedure, the technical scope of services previously ordered under BEACON lot 1 will also be covered by the new procedure. Consequently, the new HACS procedure is not split into lots. <br> Doc Title: High-level advice and consultancy services (HACS) <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 243317267. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-08-12. Closing Date: 2025-09-22. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

The objectives pursued are as follows:<br> . Strengthen GIS capacities in a logic of support for critical operations: it is a question of setting up a SIG environment capable of supporting operational decisions in real time, with reliable, structured, geolocalized and contextual data, for all the actors concerned.<br> . Guarantee the operational continuity of the GIS services, even in crisis: the GIS must remain available and functional, whatever the circumstances (network breakdowns, power outages, overload of systems, etc.), in particular thanks to mechanisms of tolerance to breakdowns, of Offline synchronization and recovery after disaster.<br> Implementing robust technical solutions, audited and tested regularly under constraint: the SIG environment must be able to be validated through load, resilience, and rigorous security tests, in order to guarantee its performance in real conditions. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG GROW - INTERNAL MARKET, INDUSTRY, ENTREPRENEURSHIP AND SMES. Summary: Development and Adaptation of Life Cycle Information for Construction Products to be Used in the Context of Regulation (Eu) 2024/3110. Description: This call for tenders includes the development of Construction Products Regulation (CPR - Regulation (EU) 2024/3110) compliant datasets related to construction products. In case datasets are not available in the environmental footprint compliant databases they will be developed for its use both under the CPR and as environmental footprint compliant datasets. In case they are already available in the environmental compliant databases, they will be developed for its use under the CPR taking the environmental footprint compliant databases as input. The tenders shall provide information about the scope of pre-existing information/data, their source and when and how the rights to these information/data have been or will be acquired. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: AG DIGIPOLIS ANTWERP. Summary: Btw Add on Sap. Description: The Antwerp group is working on the rollout of a new version of its common financial platform: SAP S/4HANA. In addition, the group wishes to purchase an extra tool for facilitating the VAT deputy and calculation. This assignment includes the analysis, product choice and implementation of This tool, connected to the current project. In addition, the assignment includes a partnership for adjustments and maintenance of this tool. Product choice. Determining the correct VAT rates is a complex matter that depends, among other things, on the legal status of the entity, the nature of the operations and the nature of the opposing party. We are looking for a product, "Add On" that follows Belgian legislation and resolves the complexity for users and the bookkeepers. The solution must have already proven itself at other, similar companies or organizations. The add-on is added On the SAP Rise Platform with which the group members work. No expansion of infrastructure is needed and the tool should not be any obstacle to continuing to follow the SAP updates. The add-on does not use GDPR sensitive data and does not do logs of the client IP addresses. It is limited to Correctly calculating VAT a.d.h.v. set parameters. For more detail we refer to the attached draft memorandum.<br> DP-A-C00642-1<br> The Antwerp group is working on the rollout of a new version of its common<br> Financial platform: SAP S/4HANA. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: SNCB. Summary: Digital Display Software/ Narrowcasting with Implementation. Description: The SNCB has a network of 300 to 350 installations for digital signage/narrowcasting spread over more than 100 sites in Belgium. This solution, B-Vision, is an essential tool for the SNCB in order to inform its employees in the field (train guides, train drivers, staff in stations and workshops, etc.). The content distributed on the screens consists in part of corporate content and partly of local/operational content. Several hundred content creators from all directions of the SNCB, can publish content with different Rights levels: Some may publish content on a single screen, others on a game (for example, all screens of train drivers) or on the entire network. The content is targeted in the level of an individual installation (for example, specific information for Employees of a specific train driving, train control, etc.). Communication is for employees in Dutch, French and English. The SNCB wishes to replace its existing software for digital/narrowcasting display in its buildings and put Lays a ready -to -use tool, with as few customizations as possible. The SNCB is looking for a partner capable of providing software and implementation services for this software (tool configuration, possible customizations to meet requirements, support, support, d.... input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: SNCB. Summary: Digital Display Software/ Narrowcasting with Implementation. Description: The SNCB has a network of 300 to 350 installations for digital signage/narrowcasting spread over more than 100 sites in Belgium. This solution, B-Vision, is an essential tool for the SNCB in order to inform its employees in the field (train guides, train drivers, staff in stations and workshops, etc.). The content distributed on the screens consists in part of corporate content and partly of local/operational content. Several hundred content creators from all directions of the SNCB, can publish content with different Rights levels: Some may publish content on a single screen, others on a game (for example, all screens of train drivers) or on the entire network. The content is targeted in the level of an individual installation (for example, specific information for Employees of a specific train driving, train control, etc.). Communication is for employees in Dutch, French and English. The SNCB wishes to replace its existing software for digital/narrowcasting display in its buildings and put Lays a ready -to -use tool, with as few customizations as possible. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: FLEMISH UTILITY REGULATOR. Summary: Expanding and Maintaining Product Database and V-Test(R). Description: The V-Test(r) (www.vtest.be) is a free online comparison tool for energy contracts. A user can compare prices and other characteristics of all electricity and natural gas contracts offered by energy suppliers active in Flanders. On January 11, 2022, the Flemish utility regulator A new version of the V-Test(r) and the underlying product database. In that database, the details of all contract versions are stored, such as prices, discounts, options,…. The product database forms the heart of the V-Test(r) and is the unique data factory for all statistics That we publish on www.vlaamsenutsregulator.be/energiemarkt-cermers about prices and contracts, for information that we transfer to the index committee every month,…. On the one hand, this assignment includes maintaining and managing the existing V-Test(r) system and product database underlying. In addition, the Flemish utility regulator can implement additional functionalities during the term of this assignment, which must then also be maintained and managed.<br> BE/VNR/0112 - 1<br> DOC Title: Expanding and maintaining Product Database and V-Test(r)<br> Contract type: services. In that database, the details of all contract versions are stored, such as prices, discounts, options,…. On the one hand, this assignment includes maintaining and managing the existing V-Test(r) system and product database underlying. In addition, the Flemish utility regulator can implement additional functionalities during the term of this assignment, which must then also be maintained and managed.<br> BE/VNR/0112 - 1<br> DOC Title: Expanding and maintaining Product Database and V-Test(r)<br> Contract type: services

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: A.S.T.R.I.D. SA IN PUBLIC LAW. Summary: Sig Consultancy. Description: This market is part of an operational context with high criticality, where geographic information systems play a strategic role in supporting emergency interventions, interservice coordination and activity continuity. The objectives pursued are as follows:<br> . Strengthen GIS capacities in a logic of support for critical operations: it is a question of setting up a SIG environment capable of supporting operational decisions in real time, with reliable, structured, geolocalized and contextual data, for all the actors concerned.<br> . Guarantee the operational continuity of the GIS services, even in crisis: the GIS must remain available and functional, whatever the circumstances (network breakdowns, power outages, overload of systems, etc.), in particular thanks to mechanisms of tolerance to breakdowns, of Offline synchronization and recovery after disaster.<br> Implementing robust technical solutions, audited and tested regularly under constraint: the SIG environment must be able to be validated through load, resilience, and rigorous security tests, in order to guarantee its performance in real conditions. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: BRUSSELS AIRPORT COMPANY NV. Summary: Airport-Wide Baggage Control Software (Awbc). Description: This contract concerns a framework agreement with one company with different sub -assignments (in accordance with the measurement statement) with a duration of 10 years, twice extended with a period of 5 years, for the implementation, integration and maintenance of the airport -wide baggage control software (AWBC). The AWBC system is a centralized software platform that acts as the nerve center of the BAC baggage handling system (BHS). It offers services to integrate various IT and OT systems (sorters, load cells, etc.), exchange data between systems for sorting Luggage, managing batch processing, and supervising supervision and management on the full luggage handling within the airport infrastructure. The main objective is to obtain a solution for the implementation, delivery and operation of the central system of the Awbc. The AWBC software states BAC able to: • have a new, future -proof, centralized luggage control system • to be able to integrate the existing sorting machines into the new platform • have a maintenance contract to support this solution<br> BAC/2025/042 - 1<br> Airport-Wide Luggage Control Software (AWBC)<br> Doc Title: Airport-Wide Baggage Control Software (AWBC)<br> Contract Type: services. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: BELGIAN INSTITUTE FOR POSTAL SERVICES AND TELECOMMUNICATIONS. Summary: Coverage Measurements of the Belgian Railways. Description: This assignment aims to receive measurement results from the measurement of mobile coverage of the Belgian railways by the four active mobile operators, both outside and inside the trains. It implies the intervention of external expertise to automated, accurate and reproducible to implement measurements. The assignment requires the installation of the necessary measurement setups on the trains and the processing of the measured data by the provider with a view to checking and publishing the resulting data by the BIPT. The provider will provide the necessary measurement setups To collect data about the mobile coverage of the Belgian Railways. This includes the connectivity outside the train sets, as well as the connectivity of passengers inside the train sets. With the resulting data, the coverage of the track is mapped.<br> Spectrum/2025/Measurement_spoor/1 - 1<br> DOC Title: coverage measurements of the Belgian Railways<br> Contract type: services. Published Date: 2025-07-21. Closing Date: 2025-08-25. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: MUNICIPALITY OF AALTER. Summary: Renovation of Access and Appointment System (Incl. Ajudicines) Recycling and Green Composting Park. Description: Renovation of access and appointment system (incl. Ajudicines) Recycling and green composting park. Recycling park: Durmelaan 8, 9880 Aalter Groen -Composting Park: Durmelaan 14; 9880 Aalter The recycling park and green composting park of Aalter are accessible to residents and staff members, But also for non-residents such as, for example, established companies, Aalterse associations, owners of a second stay, etc. The Local Governance Aalter already uses an access system on both parks (barrier on entrance and barrier on exit) in which residents, employees of Aalterse companies, ... get access via eID. Residents who are not in possession of a Belgian e-ID can get access through a badge. The number of visitors who both visited parks were in 2024: • For the recycling park: 26,842 visitors (on average 91/day) • For the Green Composting Park: 69,835 Visitors - on average 259/day - on peak days up to 700/day. The recycling park is only accessible today by appointment. An appointment system offers clear benefits for both the applicant and the operation and follow -up of the parks: a more efficient course of the visit and a more planned approach. The green composting park is accessible without an appointment. Ideally, the AalterApp and the municipal website are the first simple and accessible applications for customers, to become quickly, independently and easily to the appointment management system from there Meeing .... Published Date: 2025-07-19. Closing Date: 2025-08-20. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG DIGIT - DIGITAL SERVICES. Summary: High-Level Advice and Consultancy Services (Hacs). Description: Multiple FWCs for the provision of advisory/consultancy services (high-level consultancy and studies), ensuring business continuity after the expiration of the framework contracts under Lot 2 of ‘BEACON - Benchmarking, Advisory and Consultancy Services in Information and Communication Technology' resulting from the DIGIT/2020/OP/0005 - Benchmarking, Advisory and Consultancy Services in Information and Communication Technology - Lot 1 and Lot 2 Call for Tenders published in 2021. As described above, the main scope of the new HACS procedure is the replacement of BEACON lot 2, considering that, under the original BEACON framework contracts, the majority of the services were ordered under lot 2. While BEACON lot 1 is not scheduled for replacement as a separate lot or procedure, the technical scope of services previously ordered under BEACON lot 1 will also be covered by the new procedure. Consequently, the new HACS procedure is not split into lots. <br> Doc Title: High-level advice and consultancy services (HACS) <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 243317267. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-07-18. Closing Date: 2025-09-08. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

As described above, the main scope of the new HACS procedure is the replacement of BEACON lot 2, considering that, under the original BEACON framework contracts, the majority of the services were ordered under lot 2. While BEACON lot 1 is not scheduled for replacement as a separate lot or procedure, the technical scope of services previously ordered under BEACON lot 1 will also be covered by the new procedure. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG TRADE - TRADE. Summary: Database on Forced Labour Risks under Regulation (Eu) 2024/3015 on Prohibiting Products Made with Forced Labour on the Union Market. Description: Regulation (EU) 2024/3015 on prohibiting products made with forced labour requires the Commission to establish a publicly-available, indicative and non-exhaustive database of forced labour risks in specific geographic areas and with respect to specific products. The purpose of the database is to support the work of competent authorities in assessing potential violations of the prohibition of products made with forced labour and help economic operators identify possible forced labour risks in their supply chains. The database will focus on widespread and severe risks identified on the basis of on reliable and verifiable information from international organisations and other research, academic and institutional organisations. <br> Doc Title: Database on forced labour risks under Regulation (EU) 2024/3015 on prohibiting products made with forced labour on the Union market <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 800000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-07-18. Closing Date: 2025-09-30. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Summary: Database on Forced Labour Risks under Regulation (Eu) 2024/3015 on Prohibiting Products Made with Forced Labour on the Union Market
output.Description: Regulation (EU) 2024/3015 on prohibiting products made with forced labour requires the Commission to establish a publicly-available, indicative and non-exhaustive database of forced labour risks in specific geographic areas and with respect to specific products. The purpose of the database is to support the work of competent authorities in assessing potential violations of the prohibition of products made with forced labour and help economic operators identify possible forced labour risks in their supply chains. The database will focus on widespread and severe risks identified on the basis of on reliable and verifiable information from international organisations and other research, academic and institutional organisations. <br> Doc Title: Database on forced labour risks under Regulation (EU) 2024/3015 on prohibiting products made with forced labour on the Union market <br> Contract Type: services

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: INSTITUT POUR L'ÉGALITÉ DES FEMMES ET DES HOMMES. Summary: Supply of Various Forensic Equipment to Sexual Assault Centres. Description: These are mini-tapes that allow traces to be taken directly from clothing if the victim does not wish to undress and/or hand over their clothes. These mini-tapes must comply with point 4.3 of the latest version of the ISO 18385 standard specifying requirements to produce the products used to collect, store, and analyse biological material for forensic purposes. They should be approximately 70 x 15 mm in size. They should come with a plastic container for storage. <br> Doc Title: Supply of various forensic equipment to Sexual Assault Centres <br> Contract Type: supplies. Published Date: 2025-07-18. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: FLEMISH GOVERNMENT. Summary: Rfi - Invitation Market Consultation 'Smart Building Automation'. Description: PIO, the Flemish Energy Company (VEB) and Addestino invite you to the market consultation in the context of the Energy Saving project through smart building automation. This market consultation takes place in Brussels on 26 September from 1 pm to 5 pm. What? The Flemish energy company is investigating the Possibilities of smart building automation to reduce energy consumption and CO2 emissions of public buildings. We are looking for innovative solutions in which the existing individual systems with minimal interventions can be controlled as a whole. In the first instance this will happen Via a number of pilot projects in various building types. The aim of the pilot project is to demonstrate that a building management system (GBS) effectively contributes to the reduction of energy consumption and CO2 emissions, whereby it is possible to perform performance, effectiveness, user-friendliness and costs to evaluate. By using existing infrastructure and additional sensors and actuators, the VEB wants to gain insight into the actual impact of smart automation on energy consumption and CO2 emissions, and thus lay the foundation for scalable solutions within public sector. During the market consultation we want to "match" the needs from VEB with (sub) solutions available on the market. The intention is to find out to what extent companies can provide concrete solutions for the needs and needs of VEB, and how innovative, feasible (in terms of time.... Published Date: 2025-07-16. Closing Date: 2025-08-30. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: FLEMISH GOVERNMENT. Summary: Rfi - Invitation Market Consultation 'Integrated Approach Road Safety'. Description: WV and DMOW want to tackle road safety proactively by not just relying on historical accident figures. They are looking for an innovative method that maps the safety of every road segment and intersection with the help of data and risk models. They want a flexible platform Combining different models into one powerful safety analysis, fully transparent and sensitive to policy changes. Purpose Project AWV and DMOW are looking for a proactive method to identify black and gray points on the road network. The new approach must be a safety or Award insecurity score to every point on the network. This score must be accurate, explainable, sensitive to changes and adaptable to policy changes. Black points are currently being identified on the basis of historical accident and victim figures. This reactive method Do not take other relevant data sources into account, such as road infrastructure or traffic volume. To tackle this limitation, AWV and DMOW propose the development of a data and model orchestration platform that can perform multiple risk models based on various, geographically linked data sources (always linked to the GRB). Each model will generate a safety score for every road segment and every intersection. The platform must: be able to calculate the scores of each model and export these scores as input for an umbrella (combination) model full tracing baa .... Published Date: 2025-07-16. Closing Date: 2025-08-30. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Rfi - Invitation Market Consultation 'Integrated Approach Road Safety'
output.Description: WV and DMOW want to tackle road safety proactively by not just relying on historical accident figures. They are looking for an innovative method that maps the safety of every road segment and intersection with the help of data and risk models. They want a flexible platform Combining different models into one powerful safety analysis, fully transparent and sensitive to policy changes. Purpose Project AWV and DMOW are looking for a proactive method to identify black and gray points on the road network. The new approach must be a safety or Award insecurity score to every point on the network. This score must be accurate, explainable, sensitive to changes and adaptable to policy changes. Black points are currently being identified on the basis of historical accident and victim figures. This reactive method Do not take other relevant data sources into account, such as road infrastructure or traffic volume. To tackle this limitation, AWV and DMOW propose the development of a data and model orchestration platform that can perform multiple risk models based on various, geographically linked data sources (always linked to the GRB). Each model will generate a safety score for every road segment and every intersection. The platform must: be able to calculate the scores of each model and export these scores as input for an umbrella (combination) model full tracing baa ...

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: THE DELTA. Summary: Project Leader Implementation Jira Platform. Description: Within AZ Delta use is made of the Freshservice application of supplier FreshWorks. This ITMS tool is mainly used within IT, but also limited within the lab and the HRM department of AZ Delta. In 2024, within IT AZ Delta, the choice was made to place documentation in Atlassian's confluence. Given the strong integration/link between Confluence and the Jira platform, we want to make the switch from FreshService to the Jira Service Management Platform. This is initially for the IT service and the lab that handle tickets within this package, in a later phase also our HRM department that processes certain applications in this way. We therefore strive to make a switch from our current ITMS tool to the Jira Platform by 1 April 2026 because our licenses will be canceled on 1 May. To this end, we are looking for a project leader for the implementation of the Jira Platform. Category (CPV code): IT Services: Consulting, Software Development, Internet and Support (72000000). Summary: Rfi- Invitation Market Consultation 'Development of a Measurement and Determination Strategy for Calculation Co₂ Footprint in the Healthcare Sector'. Description: Hospital Aan de Stroom (ZAS) wants to map and calculate its own CO2 footprint so that they can take targeted actions to reduce emissions. The tool that ZAS is looking for must contain the following things: - A Meet & Decision strategy from which action points around Sustainability determine can be - an ESG CO2 Care specific reporting platform that: • Automates the CO2 calculation and perform simulations to measure the impact of measures. • A data platform that supports the above functionality. This market consultation focuses primarily on companies who offer an existing CO2 reporting & data platform and have the necessary expertise about CO2 and ESG to adapt this to the healthcare sector or companies that implement a platform of a third party together with their own advice and expertise. Participation is free, but registration is mandatory. instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: FLEMISH DEPARTMENT FOR EMPLOYMENT AND VOCATIONAL TRAINING. Summary: Platform Micro Learning. Description: The project concerns the development and offering of micro-learning via a web app on the smartphone. The project idea fits within "Efficient Organization" and aims to optimally offer the many training courses that Changes support so that the learning time is minimal and the retention is maximum. The content Creation is already possible, the content distribution to Mobile Devices is not possible today. The project is therefore not about creating a platform, but about distributing knowledge and content. The current, existing systems have already been viewed and appear to have too many disadvantages or not to suffice. There are enough tools in the house for content creation today, not yet for its distribution.<br> The main objective is therefore distribution of a skill -based approach to learning in which information is offered in small, highly focused fragments. It's the ideal way to fast answers to specific problems. instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: SIBELGA. Summary: Control System Adms (Future Requirements). Description: In dit document beschrijft Sibelga de toekomstige behoeften voor de ontwikkeling van haar bedrijfsvoeringssysteem (ADMS). Elke behoefte wordt beschreven in termen van onze huidige visie op de evolutie van het net van Sibelga naar een intelligenter en actiever beheer (Smart-Grid). Deze beschrijving is voor aanpassing vatbaar. Deze behoeften kunnen als volgt worden samengevat: Sibelga wil tools implementeren om het gevaar voor congestie van haar netwerk in realtime ofzelfs enkele dagen vooraf te kunnen detecteren. Zodra de risico's geïdentificeerd zijn, moet de meest geschikte actie worden ondernomen om ze beperkt te houden. Twee soorten acties worden overwogen: rechtstreekse acties (sturen van instructies of een Operational envelope) betreffende de gebruikers van de risicozone, of onrechtstreekse acties door de zones te melden aan de marktspelers, zodat zij de gepaste acties kunnen ondernemen. Twee extra behoeften worden toegevoegd. Het gaat om de constructie van een digital twin en een netsimulator voor oefeningen en opleidingen. Deze functies zijn gelinkt aan de vorige, in die zin dat ze op hetzelfde netmodel en dezelfde berekeningswijze steunen. Van de respondenten wordt verwacht dat ze voor elke behoefte beschrijven waarover ze reeds beschikken en welke grote of kleine verschillen er zijn ten opzichte van deze beschrijving. Om aan het RFI te voldoen, hoeft niet op alle behoeften gereageerd te worden. Een uitvoerige lijst van vragen bevindt zich op het einde van het documen.... Published Date: 2025-07-03. Closing Date: 2025-08-17. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: FLEMISH UTILITY REGULATOR. Summary: Expanding and Maintaining a Data Platform with Extranet. Description: The Flemish utility regulator has a data platform, in an Azure environment. The data platform offers the following options: a structured central storage of all Flemish utilities data data. Maintaining historical versions of the data, so that it is possible to check Who made what changes and which version applied on a certain date. To be able to do the necessary reporting of/analysis on the data on the data platform via a BI tool. To use the output of the data platform again as input for other applications (for example GroenCheck, service check, ...). The storage and processing of larger amounts of data forwarded by the energy players on the market. For the exchange of data between Flemish utility regulator and various energy players, a GUI was developed as an extra layer above the data platform, namely a Extranet. Via the extranet, energy players exchange their files with the Flemish utility regulator so that they are immediately in the right location. In this way, no complex interfaces are needed between different systems. On the one hand, this assignment includes maintaining and managing the existing Dataplatform with Extranet, on which several use cases have already been developed. In addition, the Flemish utility regulator can implement additional use cases during the term of this assignment, which must then also be maintained and managed.<br> BE/VNR/0114 - 1<br> The Flemish utility regulator has e.... Published Date: 2025-07-02. Closing Date: 2025-09-04. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: REGIONAAL TECHNOLOGISCH CENTRUM ANTWERPEN. Summary: Crm Rtc Antwerpen. Description: RTC Antwerp currently has six employees, each responsible for specific areas of expertise. Based on these areas, they build their own networks and maintain contacts independently. Contact details are currently kept individually, often in Excel, Outlook, or other personal files. RTC Antwerp has a clear and functional website. Most contact data is collected via registration or request forms on the website. However, there is a strong internal need to manage this data in a structured and centralized way. In addition, RTC Antwerp observes that a lot of data circulates within the organization, often in a fragmented manner. Data must regularly be processed, copied, or manually counted multiple times—for instance, for reporting to authorities or subsidy providers, creating thematic contact lists, or sending newsletters. As a result, there is a growing need for a streamlined and efficient approach to managing contacts, registrations, material loans, and other data flows. RTC Antwerp is therefore seeking a stable and high-performing CRM system that is compatible with the existing website and capable of structurally supporting these needs. Project Goals Internal Processes RTC Antwerp aims to improve internal efficiency by automating workflows and centralizing information related to planning, events, and contacts. The goal is to significantly reduce the time currently spent on repetitive administrative tasks, creating more room for what truly matters: sustainable relationship management .... Published Date: 2025-07-01. Closing Date: 2025-08-01. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN INNOVATION COUNCIL AND SMES EXECUTIVE AGENCY (EISMEA), EISMEA - EUROPEAN INNOVATION COUNCIL AND SMES EXECUTIVE AGENCY. Summary: Stakeholders Support Platform. Description: The subject of this call for tenders “Stakeholders Support Platform” is to renew and enhance the existing Transition Pathways Stakeholder Support Platform (transition-pathways.europa.eu). The objective is to further develop, maintain and improve the existing Transition Pathways Stakeholder Support Platform to an even more integrated and collaborative tool for industrial ecosystems to support public and private stakeholders in their green and digital transitions, resilience, and competitiveness. Under the renewed - and renamed - ‘Stakeholders Support Platform-, this will be a one stop shop, which provides a user-friendly entry point for stakeholders: - to access actively updated information and links to official and community resources relevant for each ecosystem; - to find constantly updated knowledge on ongoing projects, EU policy implementation, activities, business and best practices and events for each ecosystem; - to provide a means to connect with, engage and work together with the members of the stakeholder community and - to search or to be alerted about topical current funding and learning opportunities or other developments . <br> Doc Title: Stakeholders Support Platform <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 4000000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-06-30. Closing Date: 2025-08-14. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Other Funding Agencies

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: TOURISM OSTEND VZW. Summary: Delivering and Implementing a Ticketing System for Kursaal Ostend. Description: Kursaal Oostende is a renowned concert hall that organizes a wide range of live events. As part of the continuous efforts to improve ticket purchase experience, the contracting authority strives to select a ticketing partner who can support them in reaching From their goals and the provision of high -quality services to the Kursaal, her promoters and her end customers, the ticket buyers. The Kursaal has a theater hall of 2,000 seats currently in renovation and is being transformed into a multifunctional concert hall. A room where not only sitting Performances of up to 2,000 people can take place, but also a room where 3,150 people can enjoy a concert in standing arrangement. Various genres are discussed, ranging from comedy to dance, modern, pop, rock, ... to musicals. The reopening of the large hall is provided for autumn 2026. In the past the Kursaal can look back on an average of 180,000 tickets per year. With the expansion of the facilities in the hall, more events will take place and you estimate to grow to an average of 220,000 tickets per year. The Kursaal must be the ticketing system Being able to use completely autonomously, set up events, manage reports, ... The Kursaal will be the contact person with the organizer. The operation of the concert hall falls as a separate unit under VZW Tourism Ostend. The latter is the contracting authority. It is chosen for it syst.... Published Date: 2025-06-27. Closing Date: 2025-08-04. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: THE BELGIAN STATE, REPRESENTED BY BELNET, STATE SERVICE WITH SEPARATE MANAGEMENT. Summary: Implementing, Migrating and Maintaining a Cloud-Based Solution with Underlying Crm System and the Linked Functional Needs of Belnet.. Description: Belnet, as a state service with separate management, currently has a system for the management of customer relationships that approaches the end of its lifespan (EOL).<br> The aim of this public contract is to find a new solution to replace the existing system with a new information system, So that Belnet can guarantee the operational continuity of its services.<br> This assignment for services concerns the acquisition of a new "Cloud Based" CRM/ ERP type information system, designed to manage its contacts, its products, his services & the sales process, to generate contracts, to calculate the amounts to be invoiced, to manage the shipping of invoices and to manage marketing campaigns and the sending of mass emails ("mass mailings"), and to generate various reports.<br> For this assignment, BelNet is looking for an integrator that offers a solution or for a Enterprise that offers its own product and will take on the Integrator role. BelNet wants to indicate that the candidate can only offer one solution.<br> The assignment includes (non-limitatively) the selection of the solution, the implementation of the project in terms of implementation, rollout, education, ... In addition The assignment also consists of the implementation of support and maintenance during the life of the system to be installed.<br> Licenses:<br> -----------<br> The AO will have to purchase the necessary licenses from the contractor for this assignment.<br> "Implementation phase" :<br> ---------------------.... Published Date: 2025-06-27. Closing Date: 2025-08-29. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG ENER - ENERGY. Summary: Secretariat of the Eu Initiative for Coal Regions in Transition. Description: Secretariat of the EU Initiative for Coal Regions in Transition. The action will be implemented via a service contract, covering the following tasks: - organisation of events, both in cooperation with the Just Transition Platform and the Net Zero Europe Platform and independently, for the benefit of stakeholders in EU coal, peat and oil shale regions, fostering the sharing of experience and knowledge on transition-related issues across Europe in particular with a renewed focus on net zero industrialisation and competitiveness, as well as energy citizen empowerment and protection; - technical support and capacity building for EU coal, peat and oil shale regions; - development of knowledge products on issues of direct relevance for coal, peat and oil shale regions (e.g. case studies on good and bad practices, net zero technologies, competitiveness, renewable energy and energy efficiency) - communications and dissemination of results in the EU, sharing the EU experience in supporting coal, peat and oil shale regions internationally. This new service contract will continue develop and implement the tasks, already started in 2022. <br> Doc Title: Secretariat of the EU Initiative for Coal Regions in Transition <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 4000000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-06-25. Closing Date: 2025-08-25. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG CNECT - COMMUNICATIONS NETWORKS, CONTENT AND TECHNOLOGY. Summary: Virtual Human Twins Platform Project Support Office. Description: On 16 April 2024, the European Commission launched a call for tenders for a procurement of a state-of-the-art platform for advanced VHT integration and validation models (henceforth referred to as VHT Platform), funded under the Digital Europe Work Programme 2023-2024. The main objective is to develop a distributed platform enabling users to develop, test and integrate VHT models. In the context of the VHT Platform, the Commission is launching this procurement to establish a Project Support office (PSO) that will provide support and advice in managing the Advanced VHT Platform framework contract (FWC) and specific contract(s). The PSO will provide quality assurance for all the deliverables produced by the contractors, and offer strategic and technical advice to assist the Contracting Authority. The ultimate aim of this procurement is for the PSO to assist the Contracting Authority in ensuring that the work of the Advanced VHT Platform contractors adheres to the highest quality standards, methodologies and best practices, meeting all specifications outlined in the Advanced VHT Platform contract. Moreover, the PSO will aid the Contracting Authority in efficiently and effectively managing the Advanced VHT Platform contract and contractors, thus contributing to the successful execution and delivery of the Advanced VHT Platform project and to fulfilling the objectives of the European Virtual Human Twins Initiative. <br> Doc Title: Virtual Human Twins Platform Project Support Office.... Tender Value: 480000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-06-25. Closing Date: 2025-07-28. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Commission

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG CNECT - COMMUNICATIONS NETWORKS, CONTENT AND TECHNOLOGY

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: AG DIGIPOLIS ANTWERP. Summary: Btw Add on Sap. Description: The Antwerp group is working on the rollout of a new version of its common financial platform: SAP S/4HANA. In addition, the group wishes to purchase an extra tool for facilitating the VAT deputy and calculation. This assignment includes the analysis, product choice and implementation of This tool, connected to the current project. In addition, the assignment includes a partnership for adjustments and maintenance of this tool. Product selection. Determining the correct VAT rates is a complex matter that depends, among other things, on the legal status of the entity, the nature of the operations and the nature of the opposing party. We are looking for a product, "Add On" that follows Belgian legislation and resolves the complexity for users and the bookkeepers. The solution must have already proven itself at other, similar companies or organizations. The add-on is added On the SAP Rise Platform with which the group members work. No expansion of infrastructure is needed and the tool should not be any obstacle to continuing to follow the SAP updates. The add-on does not use GDPR sensitive data and does not do logs of the client IP addresses. It is limited to Correctly calculating VAT a.d.h.v. set parameters. For more detail we refer to the attached draft memorandum.<br> DP-A-C00642-1<br> The Antwerp group is working on the rollout of a new version of its common<br> Financial platform: SAP S/4HANA. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: CLEAN HYDROGEN JOINT UNDERTAKING. Summary: “European Hydrogen Refuelling Stations Availability System”. Description: Procurement of services for the operation, maintenance, and further development of the European Hydrogen Refuelling Stations Availability System (E-HRS-AS). The contractor will ensure continuity of the current platform and support compliance with new legal obligations under the Alternative Fuels Infrastructure Regulation (AFIR), in particular real-time data sharing with National Access Points (NAPs) and integration with the European data ecosystem (EAFO, TENtec). The services will cover platform hosting and maintenance, data availability from HRS, user experience improvements, technical upgrades, and stakeholder engagement. There is no existing framework contract that covers this specific combination of IT maintenance, AFIR compliance support, and data integration for hydrogen mobility. A new procurement is necessary to ensure regulatory alignment, data continuity, and functional improvements beyond the scope of the previous contract, while planning for the end of public funding. <br> Doc Title: “European Hydrogen Refuelling Stations Availability System” <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 600000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-06-19. Closing Date: 2025-07-28. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Other Funding Agencies

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: GRIMBERGEN. Summary: Purchase of Gis Software. Description: The municipality of Grimbergen is looking for a new GIS solution. This solution is two -fold: on the one hand to support the internal services of the board, on the other hand to better inform its residents. For the internal support it is about: 1. Consulting geodata and updating via made up counter/environment/…; 2. To consult tax and current cadastral information; 3. Automatically enrich and further process requests from the real estate information platform; 4. Simply test the necessary geodata in the context of permit applications; 5. Make applications available to employees via mobile phone/tablet to support their duties, often but not exclusively for checks from/on the public domain (green maintenance, roads, enforcement, sewerage, public cleanliness, etc.); 6. Supporting asset management and reporting management by adding a geo-component (visualizations of Locations of reports, of present assets at a location, etc.) that can be integrated with the current operation of the board. The externally focused Liege must allow the board to make environments/counters/… aimed at citizens to make a selection of geodata available (consult) via An online environment/website. The use of this environment/website can ideally be monitored per counter (number of hits, duration of visitors, etc.). In addition, it must be possible to make reports on specific assets (edit) through a publicly available environment.<br> Category (CPV code): Progr.... Published Date: 2025-06-17. Closing Date: 2025-07-10. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION, DG TRADE - TRADE. Summary: Database on Forced Labour Risks under Regulation (Eu) 2024/3015 on Prohibiting Products Made with Forced Labour on the Union Market Open Procedure. Description: Regulation (EU) 2024/3015 on prohibiting products made with forced labour requires the Commission to establish a publicly-available, indicative and non-exhaustive database of forced labour risks in specific geographic areas and with respect to specific products. The purpose of the database is to support the work of competent authorities in assessing potential violations of the prohibition of products made with forced labour and help economic operators identify possible forced labour risks in their supply chains. The database will focus on widespread and severe risks identified on the basis of on reliable and verifiable information from international organisations and other research, academic and institutional organisations. <br> Doc Title: Database on forced labour risks under Regulation (EU) 2024/3015 on prohibiting products made with forced labour on the Union market Open procedure <br> Contract Type: services.
