input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: COST ASSOCIATION. Summary: Multiannual Contract for the Accounting System Services of the Cost Association (Aisbl). Description: The purpose of this Call for tender is to conclude a multiannual contract whose object is to provide services to the Accounting system of the COST Association (AISBL), including the integration of a procure to pay solution. The COST Association intends to ensure the maintenance and required developments as service support of the Accounting system (Microsoft Business Central), as well as integration of a procurement to pay module (currently a development in SharePoint) and an employee expense module (current solution provided via Expensya). It is expected that the service support shall be based on a fix hourly price. Solution for employee expense module and Procurement to pay module shall be based on price of the solution, integration and training to selected users. The maintenance and solution for procurement to pay are mandatory for which tenderer shall bid. The solution for employee expense is not mandatory, however options can be presented.<br> Category (CPV code): Accounting software development services (72212443). Published Date: 2025-06-11. Closing Date: 2025-07-09. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Multiannual Contract for the Accounting System Services of the Cost Association (Aisbl)

The tool should be available to the EU-RAIL Programme Office and the EU-RAIL JU Members. <br> Doc Title: Europe-s Rail Multi-Project Collaborative Tool <br> Contract Type: services

In addition, the results must be compared with the alreadyExisting database of traffic signs. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: CIPAL DV. Summary: Framework Agreement for the Development and Support of Citizen Participation: Digital Platform and Participation Processes with Support Services. Description: The assignment is divided into two plots and must lead to a non-exclusive framework agreement with one supplier per parcel to make a digital participation platform available to support a citizen participation policy and for all necessary services at theOrganizing participation projects including the required digital instruments. <br> CSMRTBUR25 - 1 <br> The implementation of a digital participation platform, including hosting, maintenance, support and the possibility of configuration and integration tailored to the buyer (s). The platformMust be suitable for a wide range of participation forms, such as collection of ideas, surveys and reporting, and easy to manage (mainly local) boards themselves. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: UNIVERSITY ANTWERP. Summary: Shpc Infrastructure Delivery. Description: Delivery of a high performance computing (HPC) infrastructure including integration with the existing HPC environment. In addition, there is also the calculation cluster Vaughan (2020-2021), consisting of 192 CPU Nodes (Zen2 and Zen3 architecture) and threeGPU calculation nodes (a node with four Nvidia A100 and two calculation nodes with two AMD MI100). The High-Performance Interconnect is Infiniband HDR100. Vaughan has a Scratch file system based on BEEGFS and a NetApp solution for the other file systems (Home Directories, application softwareand permanent data). The home directories and permanent data are also exported via NFS to the other VSC sites (Flemish Supercomputer Center, www.vscentrum.be). Three chillers have been installed for the cooling of the machines. We work with Inrow Coolers. This assignment consists of theReplacement of the Leibniz cluster. Since Leibniz is part of a hot Aisle concept, this may have to be partially demolished. The new cluster will consist of calculation nodes associated with a fast interconnect, accompanying loginnodes and management nodes, storage system, and possibly someNodes to experiment with visualization and/or accelerators. The delivery embraces the installation of the machine ("Turn Key" solution), including cooling compatible with the current chillers. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: HIGH. Summary: Software Civil Affairs. Description: The municipality of Hooglede reviews the current software landscape around its civil affairs and reception department (population, civil status and immigration affairs). The service is currently being used in various applications from different suppliers. That has a number of limitations:• Files are becoming more complex and more and more often family members are registered in various registers and have various questions at the same time (such as an application for sustainable stay in Belgium, simultaneously with an application for Belgian nationality); • Employees whoTake different roles within the cell must regularly switch to another working environment; • The learning curve for new employees is unnecessarily large because they must get to know multiple applications; • Cost effectiveness, including in function of links to be made. That is why the board wishesto receive one total quote for the following modules with an unlimited number of user licenses: • population, including digital home control; • foreigners; • Civil status, including linking Digital Death (Elys) The following modules fall outside this assignment: • Eloket forattesten; <br> Category (CPV code): Analytical or scientific software package (48461000). Published Date: 2025-05-24. Closing Date: 2025-06-23. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: INNOVATION AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP AGENCY. Summary: Market Consultation: Ai to Support Auditors. Description: For the intelligent data mining project for audit purposes, we invite companies for an online market consultation together with Audit Vlaanderen, Vlaio and Addestino. We focus primarily on companies and (research) organizations with expertise in the points below to put togetherHands -on steps forward.: - Assist: focuses on the use of AI as a supporting and facilitating technology within the audit process. - AI Detect: Intelligent search, understand and structure the content of large volumes unstructured data (such as documents, e-mails,Interview reports, etc.) - AI Generate: the use of generative AI technologies, such as Large Language Models (LLMS), for the creation of new content based on existing data. Through this market consultation we want to check to what extent (proposed) use cases are technically feasible, whichSolutions may already exist, which risks and preconditions are relevant, which cost price framework is realistic for the respective business cases and how we best concretize our needs and translate it into a specifications for a public contract. input: Country: Belgium. Purchaser Name: AGENCE EXÉCUTIVE DU CONSEIL EUROPÉEN DE LA RECHERCHE. Summary: It Service for Supporting the Identification of Independent External Experts for the Evaluation of Proposals. Description: The ERC Scientific Council is tasked with proposing the appointment of independent external experts for the peer review evaluation of frontier research projects. The Scientific Council is equally responsible for ensuring the quality of the ERC's scientific operations by establishing positions on the selection of experts. The Scientific Council directly proposes the appointment of panel members, while the identification of independent external experts assisting the panels by working remotely has been delegated to Panel Chairs. Each year, about 35,000 independent experts are selected to take part in the evaluation of proposals. The latest developments in machine learning algorithms and semantic technologies can now be harnessed to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of this identification process. The objective is to contract an artificial intelligence-based service to assist the Scientific Council and the Panel Chairs with the identification of potential independent experts with suitable expertise profiles. The expected outcome is the implementation, provision and maintenance of the software or IT solution providing lists of potential experts, based on panel recruitment needs and on submitted proposals. <br> Doc Title: IT service for supporting the identification of independent external experts for the evaluation of proposals <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 1100000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-05-20. Closing Date: 2025-06-30. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Other Funding Agencies

Summary: Sustaining the Mission Implementation Platform for the Adaptation to Climate Change Mission. Description: Under this public procurement, the following services are expected to be provided: •Well-coordinated support to the general operation and activities of the Adaptation to Climate Change Mission, as valid service to the European Commission in the broad range of activities involved with the implementation of the Mission; •Coordination and facilitation of the Mission Community of Practice, in all its articulations (such as virtual and physical events, thematic working groups etc.), proving engaging involvement and opportunities for exchanges for all involved actors and regions, in relation to the actions they are undertaking in the field of climate resilience building; •Provide support to regions and local authorities on financing their climate resilience and adaptation projects; •Continuous and ad hoc monitoring and assistance to the European Commission in relation to any Mission evaluation, by maintaining and improving the current monitoring framework, further refining monitoring tools and KPI for the Mission, producing timely reporting on progress. •Assistance to the Commission with the overall communication on the Mission, through the different relevant channels including the Mission Portal, broadly towards citizens and also specific target audiences, helping to identify and create synergies and add value to communication, dissemination and exploitation activities of individual projects of the Mission's portfolio, and boost scientific, societal and economic impacts. •Or....
